Description: Metadata attributes for describing a tissue or tumor sample
DependsOn: Component, Biospecimen_id, Study Key, Individual Key, Model Key, Parent Biospecimen Key, Biospecimen Type, Biospecimen Acquisition Method, Biospecimen Stain, Biospecimen Species, Biospecimen Sex, Biospecimen Age at Collection, Biospecimen Age at Collection Unit, Biospecimen Tumor Type, Biospecimen Tumor Subtype, Biospecimen Tumor Grade, Biospecimen Tumor Morphology, Biospecimen Pathology, Biospecimen Composition, Biospecimen Preservation Method, Biospecimen Fixative, Biospecimen Embedding Medium, Biospecimen Site of Resection or Biopsy, Biospecimen Site of Origin, Biospecimen Timepoint, Biospecimen Collection Site, Biospecimen Therapeutic Agent, Biospecimen BioSample Identifier, Biospecimen Description

Description: Unique ID associated with a biosample, used as a key for record linking and updates
The type of biospecimen
Valid Values: Tissue, Blood, Analyte, Mouth Rinse, Stool, Urine, Ascites, Sputum, Fluids, Bone Marrow, Cells

Description: The species from which the biospecimen originates
Valid Values: African Bush Elephant, Armadillo, Asian Elephant, Boar, Cat, Chicken, Cow, Dog, Escherichia coli, Guinea Pig, Horse, Human, Mouse, Multispecies, Opossum, Rabbit, Rat, Rhesus monkey, Sheep, Trichoplax adhaerens, Unknown, Unspecified, Worm, Yeast, Fruit Fly, Zebrafish

Description: Biological sex associated with the specimen donor
Age at the time the biospecimen was collected. Please provide the unit in field Biospecimen Age at Collection Unit.
Unit associated with age at the time the biospecimen was collected.
The type of tumor associated with the specimen. Multiple values permitted, comma separated.

Description: The subtype related to the scientific determination and investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms of tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation.
Valid Values: TNBC, LumA, LumB, HER2, Not Applicable

Description: Numeric value to express the degree of abnormality of cancer cells, a measure of differentiation and aggressiveness.
Valid Values: G1, G2, G3, G4, GX, GB, High Grade, Intermediate Grade, Low Grade, unknown, Not Reported, Not Applicable

Description: The text term used to describe the type(s) of tissue contained in the biospecimen. Multiple values permitted, comma separated.
Valid Values: Primary Tumor, Metastatic Tumor, Normal Tissue, Tumor-adjacent Normal Tissue, Not Applicable

Description: Text term that represents the method used to preserve the sample.
Valid Values: Cryopreserved, Cryopreservation in liquid nitrogen - dead tissue, Cryopreservation in dry ice - dead tissue, Cryopreservation in liquid nitrogen - live cells, Formalin fixed paraffin embedded - FFPE, Formalin fixed-unbuffered, Formalin fixed-buffered, Fresh, Fresh dissociated and single cell sorted into plates in NP40 buffer, OCT, Snap Frozen, Frozen, Negative 80 Deg C, Liquid Nitrogen, Fresh dissociated, Fresh dissociated and single cell sorted, Fresh dissociated and single cell sorted into plates, Methacarn fixed paraffin embedded - MFPE, unknown, Not Reported

Attribute: Biospecimen Site of Resection or Biopsy
Description: The text term used to describe the anatomic site of the resection or biopsy of the patient's malignant disease.
Valid Values: Gonad, Abdominal Esophagus, Adipose Tissue, Adrenal Gland, Alveolus, Aorta, Artery, Ascending Colon, Bile Duct, Bladder, Blood, Blood Vessel, Bone, Bone Marrow, Brain, Breast, Caecum, Cancer-Associated Fibroblast, Cardia, Cartilage, Cervix Uteri, Choroid, Colon, Connective and Soft Tissue, Cornea, Duodenum, Ear, Embryo, Embryonic Heart, Endocervix, Endometrium, Endothelium, Epithelium, Esophagus, Eye, Fallopian Tube, Foreskin, Frontal Lobe, Gastroesophageal Junction, Gastrointestinal Tract, Genitourinary, Hair Follicle, Head and Neck, Heart, Heart Muscle, Hematopoietic System, Hippocampus, Intestine, Intra-Abdominal Lymph Nodes, Intrathoracic Lymph Nodes, Joint, Kidney, Larynx, Ligament, Liver, Lung, Lymph, Lymph Node, Lymph Nodes of Axilla or Arm, Lymph Nodes of Inguinal Region or Leg, Lymphatic System, Lymphoid Tissue, Main Bronchus, Mammary Gland, Meninges, Mesenchyme, Mucosa, Muscle, Nasal Cavity, Nervous System, Not Applicable, Olfactory Mucosa, Omentum, Oral Cavity, Oral Mucosa, Ovary, Pancreas, Pelvic Lymph Nodes, Pending Annotation, Periodontal Ligament, Peripheral Nerves, Peritoneum, Pharynx, Pituitary Gland, Placenta, Pleura, Prostate Gland, Rectum, Reproductive System, Respiratory System, Salivary Gland, Sclera, Sinonasal Tract, Skin, Small Intestine, Spinal Cord, Spleen, Stomach, Synovial Membrane, Tendon, Testis, Thymus, Thyroid Gland, Tongue, Tonsil, Trachea, Umbilical Cord, Unspecified, Uterus, Vagina, Vascular Endothelium, Vein, Vertebra, Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cell

Description: The text term used to describe the anatomic site of origin, of the patient's malignant disease.

Description: Label to identify the time point at which the clinical data or biospecimen was obtained (e.g. Baseline, End of Treatment, Overall survival, Final). NO PHI/PII INFORMATION IS ALLOWED.
The health care site at which the biospecimen sample was collected.
Text identification of the individual agent(s) used as part of a treatment regimen.

Morphology code from the third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000, and used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) of neoplasms.
The name of the compound that preserves tissues and cells in this sample for microscopic study.
The name of the material that infiltrates and supports the specimen and preserves its shape and structure for sectioning and microscopy.
Records the method of acquisition or source for the specimen under consideration
A description of the biospecimen.
The pathology identifier associated with the biospecimen.
BioSample (SAMN) accession number corresponding to the source of this biospecimen.
Biospecimen Key identifer of a biospecimen from which this sample was derived. Do not use this field to reference the source model or individual.
Any of the various methods that use a dye, reagent, or other material for producing coloration in tissues or microorganisms for microscopic examination.
